channel.title: live whonix in linux
channel.description: hi everyone, i have a question. Is it possible to make a live whonix system like how qubes works? Here's how I see it. Let's say we have linux, we run whonix on it via kvm, but when whonix is ​​closed, all this or that data written on it is not saved, and the subsequent launch is made from a cast, as on qubes. Whether it is possible to implement it somehow? The purpose of the idea is the same as that of qubes, if something bad flies on the workstation, when the station is turned off, it will be deleted without the possibility of remaining in whonix or making its way to the host. Communicating through google translator :slight_smile:

item.title: live whonix in linux
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
See:

Kicksecure – 11 Apr 22

Host Live Mode: Boot existing Host Operating System into Live Mode

Add a Live Mode entry to the grub boot menu on your existing Debian host platform. Stop Persistent Malware. Read-only mode. Make all writes go to non-persistent storage (RAM) instead of the hard disk.

Or.

Kicksecure – 11 Apr 22

VM Live Mode: Stop Persistent Malware

Read-only mode. Make all writes go to non-persistent memory (RAM) instead of the hard disk. This is NOT an anti-forensics feature! For anti-forensics, check out Host Live Mode.

(Whonix is based on Kicksecure.)
